reason.tex: %text The vector equation of a plane whose normal is along{\bf unit vector} $\hat n$ and which is at a distance $d$ from the origin, is given by $\ora{r}\cdot\hat{n}=d$. Therefore we must first establish the unit vector in the direction of the given normal, % \begin{align} \ora{N}&=\vector{2}{-3}{6} \\ |\ora{N}|&=\sqrt{2^2+(-3)^2+6^2}=\sqrt{4+9+36}=7 \\ \therefore\hat n &=\dfrac{\ora{N}}{|\ora{N}|}= \dfrac{1}{7}\left(\vector{2}{-3}{6}\right) \end{align} \\ %text Therefore the equation of the given plane would be, % \begin{align} \ora{r}\cdot \dfrac{\ora{N}}{|\ora{N}|}= \dfrac{1}{7}\left(\vector{2}{-3}{6}\right)=5 \end{align}
